description: Values taken by the sigma(n) function A000203, sorted into ascending order.
comments: A175192(a(n)) = 1, A054973(a(n)) >= 1. - _Jaroslav Krizek_, Mar 01 2010a(n) is the median of the values of A000203(m) from m=1 to m=2n-1. (This needs confirmation as it relies on the assumption that A000203(n) is always bigger than the median of the values A000203(x) from x=1 to x=n.) - _Chayim Lowen_, May 27 2015
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
mathematica: terms = 68; ClearAll[t]; t[k_] := t[k] = Sort[ Table[ DivisorSigma[1, n], {n, 1, k*terms}]][[1 ;; terms]]; t[k = 2]; While[t[k] != t[k-1], k++]; t[k] (* _Jean-FranÃ§ois Alcover_, Nov 21 2012 *)With[{nn=80},Take[Sort[DivisorSigma[1,Range[nn*100]]],nn]] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Mar 09 2016 *)
author: _Walter Nissen_
